intro: Elatostema intanondense, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a member of the family Urticaceae, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema intanondense is a perennial herb that thrives in humid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
